title: Glisha
author: Glisha
content: Hey, guys, I have a Bitman USB miner first edition its standing in my desk for years and now I'm looking maybe to sell it because some people would love to have something like this. i just found 1 auction online that was selling 1 but no more info about it so I was like ok let's ask my BTC friends what they think about it ? Any good suggestion is welcome! I think the device is new and it was not used as I remember. don't know is there a way to I can check it but yeah there we goHere I pictured it :https://i.imgur.com/F6WFVJa.jpghttps://i.imgur.com/YgePeW2.jpghttps://i.imgur.com/xjh4Fr2.jpghttps://i.imgur.com/eOZyxAn.jpgTnx for any help or info  Glisha

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: @GlishaIt's been a while since I last saw someone listing an Antminer U1 for sale and based on "this Amazon price history chart [I just found it on Google]", I'd say $100 to $150 is a fair price [as a collectible item] for this beauty.- BTW, I also don't know if there's a way to check if they've been used in the past or not.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: From time to time you can see them offered for 10 usd on eBay where I live. I think people should not start to collect random hardware that serves no purpose

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: hZti on November 17, 2022, 10:55:23 PMI think people should not start to collect random hardware that serves no purpose  You've got a point [for the most part], but when a certain piece of history is attached to them, they'll always be worth more than they actually are to collectors!

comments.author: saxydev
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on November 18, 2022, 05:11:45 AMQuote from: hZti on November 17, 2022, 10:55:23 PMI think people should not start to collect random hardware that serves no purpose  You've got a point [for the most part], but when a certain piece of history is attached to them, they'll always be worth more than they actually are to collectors!There are too many available everywhere to matter the history linked to them, this is my opinion.

comments.author: Blawpaw
comments.body: Don't sell it just yet. I also have 3 of them and I'm waiting for the right time to sell it. They are a pice of Bitcoin's history but they justhave a few years, so no opne will give you too big of a price for them as they have almos no utility at this point. However, as the years go by, less and less of these equipments will be found and that will be about when collectors will pay good prices for them. Just wait at least 10 more years and I guess they will be worth a lot more.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: https://www.ebay.com/itm/325261615330?120Just list it for 222.22 eventually you will likely find a buyer.

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: Quote from: hZti on November 17, 2022, 10:55:23 PMFrom time to time you can see them offered for 10 usd on eBay where I live. I think people should not start to collect random hardware that serves no purpose  I mean isn't that what all collections are mostly.  Things that serve no purpose.  Looking at and having a piece of mining history might mean something to someone like looking at a painting.  To others paintings are just useless pieces of canvass with paint splashed on them.  To each their own right!
